newsitem.title: USA: Texas stocks outpace S&P 500 in Feb - comptroller.
newsitem.headline: Texas stocks outpace S&P 500 in Feb - comptroller.

text.p: The Texas Stock Index posted another record high last month as stock values of Texas-based companies outperformed the Standard & Poor's 500, according to State Comptroller John Sharp.

The Comptroller's office developed the monthly TSI to help measure investors' confidence in Texas-based businesses, a release from Sharp's office said. The index tracks the prices of approximately 52 stocks in four sectors of the state's economy--finance, technology, energy and general business.
"The TSI, which grew by 25.1 points in January, added another 6.7 points in February to stand at 292.6," Sharp said in a release. "The TSI is 36.2 percent higher than the level of one year ago."

In comparison, the Standard & Poor's 500, which tracks a sampling of stocks nationwide, rose by 4.6 percent in February, Sharp said. A percentage comparison shows Standard & Poor's index up 0.6 percent, while the TSI rose 2.3 percent, the release said.
